Probably not. Before Ascension was Doom Bots, which doesn't really fit with the bit about 'Frozen Watchers'. It may, however, be reference to champions instead; Braum (5th most recent champ) is of the Freljord, Azir (3rd most recent champ) is obvious being the Emperor of Shurima and Kalista (2nd most recent champ) is referenced as a leader figure in her lore.

But then again it may just be nothing.
"Leader figure"? The murderous spirit of vengeance is a leader?

It's more open to interpretation really but it states: "An ethereal tether, little more than a wisp of light, linked the newly formed shade to the avenging spirit she had summoned. Through their bond, the sword-wife saw her differently, glimpsing the noble warrior she had been in life: tall and proud, her armor gleaming. Her posture was confident, yet without arrogance; **a born leader**, a born soldier. This was a commander that the sword-wife would have willingly bled for." If you wanted to get into technicalities you could say that, having souls bound to her, she leads those who've sworn themselves to her. Like I said she's only referenced as such, there's really no evidence either way.

If you want to get technical then, "the noble warrior she had been in life".
You're talking about the visions of a dying person, seeing what Kalista USED TO BE.
She's dead now and has obviously changed. 

Also as far as the souls, that would be USING, not LEADING. 
The deal is: "Give me your soul, it will give me power and I will exact your vengeance in exchange." That's not a leader/follower relationship, that's a deal with a demon.
